indication: Chronic kidney disease, evaluate renal parenchyma, rule out nephrolithiasis
technique: Helical CT of the abdomen and pelvis was performed following the administration of 100 mL Omnipaque 350 IV contrast. Oral contrast was administered prior to examination.

findings.liver: Normal size and attenuation. No focal hepatic lesions. No intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.
findings.gallbladder: Surgically absent. Surgical clips noted in the gallbladder fossa.
findings.spleen: Normal size at 11 cm. Homogeneous attenuation.
findings.kidneys: Both kidneys are small in size. Right kidney measures 9.2 cm, left kidney measures 9.0 cm. Bilateral cortical thinning consistent with chronic kidney disease. No hydronephrosis. No nephrolithiasis. No renal masses.
findings.bladder: Moderately distended. Wall thickness is normal. No intraluminal mass.
findings.prostate: Enlarged prostate measuring approximately 45 cc, consistent with benign prostatic hyperplasia.
findings.bowel: No evidence of obstruction. No inflammatory changes.
findings.vasculature: Atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta. No aneurysm (aorta measures 2.1 cm).
findings.musculoskeletal: Degenerative changes of the lumbar spine. No suspicious osseous lesions.

impression: Bilateral small kidneys with cortical thinning, consistent with chronic kidney disease. No nephrolithiasis or hydronephrosis.
Atherosclerotic disease of the abdominal aorta without aneurysm.
comparison: No prior CT abdomen available for comparison.
